description: Molluscum Contagiosum is a viral skin infection that causes raised, round bumps on the skin. These bumps are usually painless but can be itchy and may contain a white, waxy substance.
possible causes: Direct skin-to-skin contact with an infected person
Sharing towels or other personal items with an infected person
symptoms: Small, flesh-colored or pink bumps on the skin
Bumps with a dimple in the center
Itching or tenderness in the affected area
treatments: Topical medications to help clear the bumps
Laser therapy for more severe cases
